definition: to fall into the net of justice (idiom); finally arrested
it is hard to escape the net of justice (idiom)
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
(of a thief, smuggler etc) to be caught with stolen or illegal goods/to be caught red-handed
appropriate retribution (idiom)
virtue is one foot tall, the devil ten foot (idiom); It takes constant vigilance to stave off evil.

definition: to punish according to the law/to bring to justice

definition: If you don't want anyone to know, don't do it (idiom). fig. If you do something bad, people will inevitably hear about it.
pinyin: ruo4 yao4 ren2 bu4 zhi1 , chu2 fei1 ji3 mo4 wei2
related.word: 若要人不知，除非己莫为

definition: evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
to bring to justice
